sentences.english: The military band played the national anthems of China and Spain with 21 salutes lingering in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 在雄壯的21響禮炮聲中，軍樂隊演奏中西兩國國歌。

sentences.english: The white-clad military band stood to attention.
sentences.chinese: 穿着白色制服的軍樂隊肅穆的站着。

sentences.english: The military band played the national anthems of both sides.
Perfect people hangout with their marching band friends.
sentences.chinese: 完美的人和軍樂隊的朋友聚會。

sentences.english: The brass band paraded the main street.
At the police academy, Fedorova played the saxophone as a member of the brass band.
sentences.chinese: 進入警察學院後費德洛娃吹薩克斯，是軍樂隊的成員。

sentences.english: It's quite a show complete with a 60-piece military band.
sentences.chinese: 那的確是一個表演，由60人組成的軍樂隊參加。

sentences.english: The military band played the national anthems of the two countries and a 19-gun salute was fired.
sentences.chinese: 軍樂隊奏中南兩國國歌，鳴禮炮19響。

sentences.english: If I had any plan for the future at all, it was the thought that maybe I could join an army band.
sentences.chinese: 如果說我有未來計劃的話，我尋思過加入軍樂隊。

sentences.english: It is the starting point for state visits complete with red carpets and marching bands.
sentences.chinese: 作爲國事訪問的“序章”，它配有紅地毯和軍樂隊。

sentences.english: A marching band that followed was forced to wait as the bizarre aftermath of the incident was cleared away.
sentences.chinese: 隨後的軍樂隊演奏被迫等到這個奇異事故被清理完畢。

definition: to dress (troops)/to line up (to arrange in a straight line)
Taroko, one of the indigenous peoples of Taiwan
Taichung or Taizhong county in central Taiwan
Checheng township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
both the guests and the hosts thoroughly enjoy themselves (idiom)
Dacun township in Changhua county 彰化縣|彰化县[Zhang1 hua4 xian4], Taiwan
junior high school (Tw)/abbr. to 國中|国中[guo2 zhong1]
